{{also|İnternet|internet}} ==English== ===Alternative forms=== * {{l|en|internet}} {{qualifier|see [[#Usage notes|Usage notes]] below}} ===Etymology=== (1986) Coined by the {{w|United States Department of Defense|U.S. Defense Department}}, shortening of [[internetwork]]. ===Pronunciation=== * {{a|RP}} {{IPA|en|/ˈɪntəˌnɛt/}} * {{a|US}} {{enPR|ĭnʹtərnĕt'}}, {{IPA|en|/ˈɪntɚˌnɛt/|/ˈɪɾ̃ɚˌnɛt/}} * {{audio|en|En-uk-Internet.ogg|Audio (UK)}} * {{hyphenation|en|Inter|net}} ===Proper noun=== {{en-proper noun}} # The specific [[internet]] consisting of a global [[network]] of [[computer]]s that communicate using Internet Protocol (IP) and that use Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) to identify the best paths to route those communications. #* '''2008''', Lou Schuler, "Foreword", ''in'' Nate Green, ''Built for Show'', page xi #*: {{...}}if you think the '''Internet''' existed in 1970, I can only guess that the education system has left at least one child behind. ====Usage notes==== Usage in reference to the global network [[Wikipedia:Capitalization of "Internet"|is normally capitalised]], reserving '''internet''' with a lower-case ''i'' for any other set of computer networks connected by internetworking; however, some (chiefly British) media outlets such as the BBC and the Times refer to the global network with a lower-case ''i''. Now typically prefaced by the article ''the''. ====Synonyms==== * See also [[Thesaurus:Internet]] ====Related terms==== * {{l|en|extranet}} * [[Internet of Things]] * {{l|en|intranet}} * {{l|en|break the Internet}} ====Translations==== {{trans-top|specific internet consisting of the global network of computers}} * Afrikaans: {{t+|af|Internet}} * Albanian: {{t|sq|internet|m}} * American Sign
